meanings.definition: A person or company that designs and manufactures typefaces.
meanings.sent1: The typefounders worked tirelessly to create unique fonts for the new book.
meanings.sent2: Many famous typefounders have revolutionized the world of typography.
meanings.sent3: The typefounders decided to have a font design competition for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity as a typefounder painted words on the page like a master artist.
meanings.sent5: The typefounders' workshop buzzed with the sound of printing presses.

meanings.definition: The art or process of creating new typefaces.
meanings.sent1: Learning about typefoundry involves understanding the history of fonts.
meanings.sent2: The typefoundry workshop was filled with sketches of potential typefaces.
meanings.sent3: In art class, they experimented with typefoundry techniques for a project.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a typefoundry, constantly churning out new font ideas.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of typefoundry lies in the intricate details of each letter.

meanings.definition: The industry or trade of producing printed materials using typefaces.
meanings.sent1: The typefounders' business boomed as more companies sought custom fonts.
meanings.sent2: Typefoundry plays a crucial role in the publishing world.
meanings.sent3: The typefounders' convention was a colorful display of printed materials.
meanings.sent4: In the world of advertising, typefoundry can make or break a campaign.
meanings.sent5: The typefounders' dedication to quality set them apart in the industry.
